main event: Witnesses observed a pear-shaped, aluminum-colored object in the sky over Matador, Texas on August 31, 1951.
interesting points: The object hovered at low altitude before rapidly ascending and moving in a circular pattern,The object was estimated to be 10 to 16 feet in diameter,Several witnesses, including two ladies driving, reported seeing the object which appeared to glow and move with no visible means of propulsion,The sighting occurred during a period of other unidentified object sightings in Lubbock, Texas,Weather conditions were clear with good visibility at the time of the observation.
sighted object: a pear-shaped aluminum or silver object
witness description: Two ladies driving in an automobile, found to have excellent character.
